data.title: How to Change Netflix Region and Watch any Country Version in 2024
data.meta_description: It can be frustrating when Netflix content is not available based on your location. Find out how to change region on Netflix and access your regular Netflix library as you travel.
data.text:
Are you tired of missing out on your favorite Netflix shows and movies when traveling abroad? It can be frustrating to discover that the content you love is restricted based on your current location. The good news is that you can change your Netflix region and regain access to a wider variety of content, no matter where you are in the world.

When you travel from one country to another, you may notice a significant difference in the available Netflix catalog. Certain regions have a limited selection of shows and movies, which can be disappointing for avid streamers. For example, if you’re from the US and find yourself in Spain, you’ll quickly realize that the content options are much more limited. Fortunately, by changing your Netflix region, you can bypass these restrictions and access your home library.

From experience, we have found that the easiest and most effective way to change your Netflix region is by using a Virtual Private Network (VPN). A VPN routes your internet traffic through a server in your chosen country. By doing so, it masks your actual IP address and replaces it with one from your selected country. This effectively tricks Netflix into thinking you’re streaming from that location. This means that you can easily access your home library even when you’re away from home.

Stay tuned as we walk you through the step-by-step process of changing your Netflix region using a VPN, ensuring you can enjoy your favorite content anytime, anywhere. Let’s get started!

How to change Netflix region with a VPN

Sign into a Netflix account or sign up for one.

Download and install a VPN that works for changing Netflix regions. We recommend NordVPN – the most reliable VPN for accessing other Netflix regions after vigorous testing.

Connect to a VPN server in the country you want to change to. For example, for Netflix US, you will need a VPN with servers in the United States.

Go to the Netflix website and you should see the country site for the location of your selected server.

Select a movie or TV show from that countries Netflix library and enjoy!

Note: If you encounter any issues, you should try clearing your cookies and cache. If problems persist, you will need to reach out to customer support for technical help.

Can I watch Netflix in other countries?

Yes, this method will allow you to watch Netflix anywhere abroad and is popular with people who travel frequently. For example, Americans visiting the UK will be able to securely stream American Netflix, and British travelers in the US can watch Netflix UK.

Here’s our summary of the best VPNs to change location on Netflix:

PrivateVPN: Great up-and-coming VPN which works well with Netflix and beats geographical restrictions other streaming services.

Private Internet Access: Quick and great for Netflix UK, US, and more. Has plenty of advanced security features.

PureVPN: Great for streaming Netflix thanks to fast speeds and unblocking ability. Budget-friendly with plenty of security features.

ProtonVPN: A secure VPN with 256-bit encryption, a no-logs policy and a choice of protocols. Works reliably with Netflix.

Bear in mind that Netflix is aware that subscribers are using this tactic to access different libraries and is cracking down. When it discovers that a particular IP address belongs to a VPN provider, it will block traffic from that address. In this case, you’ll see a proxy error stating:

“Whoops, something went wrong. Streaming error. You seem to be using an unblocker or proxy. Please turn off any of these services and try again.”

Many providers are committed to providing a workaround and maintaining servers that offer reliable VPN access to various Netflix libraries. Even so, not all of these providers offer a comparable service. For streaming, you need to ensure your VPN is fast and reliable. And you also want to know that your chosen provider values security and privacy to the utmost degree.

Provides fast and reliable connections for HD streaming without interruption

Keep no logs of user activity or IP addresses, with no exceptions

Offers knowledgeable and accessible customer support (preferably live chat)

Can I use a free VPN to change region on Netflix?

Free VPN providers are easy to find and can be very tempting. But we’d have to advise you to steer clear for several reasons. Providing full access to Netflix requires a lot of effort on the part of a provider, and free services aren’t profitable enough to justify the use of these resources on an ongoing basis. A free VPN might let you explore another country’s Netflix catalog, but when it comes time to watch, you’ll almost certainly encounter the proxy error.

What’s more, these services typically provide users with a limited selection of servers, which means you’re less likely to be able to access the Netflix library you’re looking for. Even if you do get access, you’ll probably be frustrated with slow connection speeds and even having to wait in a queue for some servers. You may also find free VPNs don’t offer unlimited bandwidth, making it difficult to stream HD content. This type of monthly data cap isn’t an issue when using any of the premium VPNs recommended above.

Practicality isn’t the only issue with free services. We’ve put a heavy emphasis on privacy and security above because it’s important for users to know what’s happening with their data. The providers of free VPN services need to make money somehow and often do so through questionable methods. Some interrupt your experience with annoying ads, log your activity and sell data to third parties, or even carry malware.

Which country versions of Netflix are available?

Netflix started out slowly and solely operated in the US for its first decade or so. It finally expanded internationally with Canadian Netflix in 2010, and then there was no stopping. After a massive 2016 expansion, Netflix is now available in most countries, except China, Crimea, Syria, Russia, and North Korea. When it comes to China, not wanting to miss out on this massive market, Netflix has pushed for licensing deals instead of having an actual presence in the country.

Although Netflix is available in most countries, the catalog of shows and movies varies greatly depending on your region. Aside from having different titles available, some regions have a very small selection. This is due to the different licensing agreements in each region. Our own Netflix library study showed a big difference in cost and available titles depending on where you live. There is a map on Netflix’s website that shows where the service is currently available.

How to access US Netflix

Using a VPN to access US Netflix on vacation is easy no matter where you go in the world. The only caveat is that you must pick a VPN that works, and in 2024 there are very few left that can access Netflix reliably.

In this guide, we have done the hard work by recommending the world’s best VPNs for streaming Netflix abroad. To make things even easier, we have included a short setup guide below.

Here’s how to access US Netflix while traveling abroad:

Pick a VPN that works for changing Netflix regions. We recommend NordVPN because it represents superb value, outstanding security, and fantastic speeds for streaming US Netflix and many other services.

Subscribe to the VPN. Thanks to our automated coupon, you can use our link to get the VPN at the best possible cost.

Download the VPN software. Our recommendations have apps for all platforms that are easy to install and use on any of your devices.

Install the VPN and log in using your credentials.

Pick a VPN server in the US and click to connect. If your VPN has servers labeled for US streaming, select one of these.

As soon as the VPN connection is established, your real location is concealed, and you appear to have a valid IP address in the US. That means you can launch your Netflix app or log in via the website to watch US-only shows and movies.

How to change Netflix region on iPhone

To access different Netflix libraries on your phone, you’ll need to use a VPN to spoof your location. Don’t worry, it’s not as complex as it sounds.

Here’s how to change Netflix region on iPhone:

Subscribe to a reputable VPN provider with an easy-to-use mobile app. We recommend NordVPN.

On your iPhone, go to the App Store and download and install your VPN app.

Log into the app using your VPN provider credentials.

Connect to a server location that corresponds to the Netflix library you want to watch. For example, use a US server to access Netflix US.

Now open your Netflix app, and you should have access to the library you want.

Note that even if a VPN works with the country you want, you might find that not all servers in that location will work. If you run into issues, contact your VPN’s customer support team for help with troubleshooting.

How to change Netflix region on an Android phone

Accessing a different country’s Netflix library on your Android phone is possible if you use a VPN, which is quite simple to set up.

Here’s how to change Netflix region on an Android phone:

Sign up with your chosen VPN provider (choose one with a good Android app like NordVPN).

On your Android phone, go to the Google Play Store and download the app for your VPN.

Once installed, log into the app with your new VPN credentials.

Select a server in the correct location for the Netflix library you want to watch. For example, to access Netflix UK, connect to a UK server.

Now, launch your Netflix app, and you should be able to watch content from your desired library.

Although many VPNs work with Netflix, not all work with every library, and even for the libraries they do work with, not every server will work. Netflix regularly adds new blocks, and VPN providers introduce workarounds in a cat-and-mouse game. As such, you may need to contact your VPN’s customer support team for assistance, as they can provide specific instructions.

How to change Netflix region on PS4

PS4 does not support native VPN apps, but there are still a couple of ways you can change Netflix region on your PS4. One is to use a VPN router, which will provide VPN coverage for every device that’s connected to that router. Another method involves connecting your gaming console to a VPN-connected computer via an ethernet cable, but this is fairly cumbersome.

If you’re looking for the simplest way to change Netflix region on your PS4, ExpressVPN’s MediaStreamer may be your best bet. This comes free with every ExpressVPN subscription, which is worth considering when choosing the most suitable VPN for your needs. The one issue with MediaStreamer is that it’s a DNS service versus a VPN. This means it doesn’t encrypt data so won’t protect your connection.

If you wish to try MediaStreamer, here are the steps:

Sign up for an ExpressVPN account and submit payment.

Sign in to the ExpressVPN website and go to the ExpressVPN DNS settings page.

Go to IP address registration, select Register my IP address, and toggle Automatically register my IP address to the on position.

Head to the ExpressVPN setup page and locate your MediaStreamer DNS server IP address.

On your PS4, go to Settings > Network > Set Up Internet Connection.

Under How do you want to connect to the network?, choose Use Wi-Fi or Use a LAN cable. If prompted to use your existing wifi settings, select Yes.

Under How do you want to set up the Internet connection?, choose Custom.

Select your wifi connection and enter your password.

Choose the following settings: IP Address Settings – Automatic; DHCP Host Name – Do Not Specify; DNS Settings – Manual. Then select Primary DNS.

Enter your MediaStreamer DNS server IP address (found in step 4) and click Done then Next.

Finally, select the following settings: MTU Settings – Automatic; Proxy Server – Do Not Use; Internet settings updated – Test Internet Connection.

Note you will have to restart your PS4 for these changes to take effect.

How to change Netflix region on Roku

Roku is another system that does not support native VPN apps, but if you’re willing to make some effort, you can change the Netflix region on Roku.

Here’s how to change Netflix country on Roku:

Set up a VPN router and connect your Roku to it.

Create a VPN-protected Wi-Fi hotspot on your laptop computer and connect your Roku to it.

Screencast to the Roku using a VPN-protected Android smartphone or tablet.

Finding the best VPNs for changing Netflix region: our methodology

Traveling abroad can be frustrating and finding you can no longer access your usual Netflix library from home. Unfortunately, few VPNs work well with Netflix, but the good news is that we’ve found those that do! Below, we’ll go over our methodology for finding the best VPNs for changing your Netflix region:

Our international team of researchers has tested a wide range of VPNs across dozens of Netflix libraries. That way, you can be sure those we recommend are the best available.

Global network: Netflix is available in most countries worldwide. With this in mind, it’s important to have a VPN with a global network of servers. These should be available across dozens of countries including the USA, UK, and Canada to name a few. In the case of most VPNs listed, thousands of servers are at your disposal.

Speed: At the very least, Netflix recommends a connection speed of 25 Mbps for streaming in 4K. All of the best VPNs for changing Netflix region are more than fast enough to support this. Thanks to the added benefit of unlimited bandwidth, you’ll be able to stream Netflix without lag or buffering, regardless of your location.

Security: If you want to be able to access Netflix securely, you’ll need a VPN that uses 256-bit AES encryption. It should also provide DNS leak protection and a kill switch. We test each VPN for leaks and look for those that offer extra protection, be it through Double VPN servers, an ad-blocker, or a password manager.

Privacy: Just like not every VPN changes your Netflix region, not every VPN protects your privacy. Having looked at over 140 VPN logging policies, we’ve been able to identify those that don’t keep any identifying logs of users. In many cases, you’ll even be able to pay for the VPN subscription anonymously in Bitcoin.

Apps and devices: Netflix is available across a range of devices, including Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, and more. We recommend VPNs offering simultaneous connections and apps across all major operating systems to maximize compatibility.

Ease of use: One of the advantages of testing so many VPNs is that we can discover which VPNs have the best apps. With the VPNs in this post, you’ll find apps that are easy to install and navigate. Furthermore, each VPN even has 24-hour live chat and email support should you have any questions.

Value for money: Ironically, some VPNs fail to offer much of the above yet cost significantly more than the VPNs found here! Of course, it helps that for each and every one, we offer a discount coupon. Better still, all of the best VPNs for changing your Netflix region come with a risk-free money-back guarantee.
